title: Modified Creamy Tuscan Chicken Thighs with Capers

ingredients.name: butter
ingredients.amount: 2 tbsp plus a little for searing

ingredients.name: water or chicken broth for deglazing

directions: Season chicken thighs with garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, chili powder, and salt.
Heat olive oil and a little butter in a large pan over medium-high. Sear thighs 4-5 minutes per side until golden. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add 2 tbsp butter to the pan.
Add rosemary and thyme sprigs, let them sizzle in butter for 30-45 seconds to perfume the fat.
Add cherry tomatoes, chopped capers, and red pepper flakes. Deglaze with a splash of water or broth.
Pour in heavy cream. Simmer 4-5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Stir in Parmesan and black pepper. Taste before adding salt (capers are salty).
Return chicken to pan. Spoon sauce over thighs. Simmer 3-5 minutes until cooked through.
Remove herb sprigs. Optionally squeeze lemon juice over the dish off heat.
notes: Adapted from a Creamy Tuscan Chicken recipe, substituting capers for sun-dried tomatoes, onion powder for shallot, and omitting spinach. Capers provide the same salty punch but brighter flavor. Fresh herbs (thyme and rosemary) should bloom in fat during the sauce step, not applied to raw chicken, to avoid burning. Serve with roasted zucchini/squash (425F, 15-20 min) and roasted frozen potatoes (425-450F, 25-35 min). Plate with potatoes as base, chicken and sauce over top, veggies on the side.
